title: Calories in Home Fries
meta_description: Discover calories in home fries per 100g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and tips for healthier tweaks to fit your diet.
assumptions: Homemade from diced potatoes, fried in vegetable oil with onions and salt; no additional toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, oil used, frying time, portion size, and added ingredients. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of home fries provides about 170 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of home fries?
faqs.a: Approximately 170 kcal per 100g, depending on preparation.

faqs.q: Are home fries high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 22g carbs per 100g, mainly from potatoes.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in home fries?
faqs.a: Around 8g total fat per 100g, from frying oil.

faqs.q: Can I make lower-calorie home fries?
faqs.a: Yes, bake them with minimal oil to reduce calories by 50-60 per 100g.

faqs.q: How much sodium in home fries?
faqs.a: About 300mg per 100g if salted; adjust seasoning to lower it.
